name: Not so Sloppy Joe Casserole
author: Danni Skaricki
summary: Kids and sloppy joe lovers alike will love this easy casserole especially great for a picnic or even for a cold winter day when you are craving a Sloppy Joe.
ingredients: 1 small green bell pepper, seeded and chopped  (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Cut the biscuit dough into quarters and press to cover the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish
Place the ground beef into a skillet over medium heat
Cook, stirring to crumble, until no longer pink
Add the onion and bell pepper about halfway through, cooking and stirring until tender
Drain off excess grease and stir in the sloppy Joe sauce
Season with garlic salt and pepper
Pour the mixture over the biscuits and spread to cover evenly
Bake in the preheated oven until the biscuits are cooked through, about 20 minutes
Remove from the oven and sprinkle the cheese on top
Return to the oven until the cheese has melted, about 10 more minutes
